description.p: Dragon-Kin are humanoids who carry draconic blood not as a distant echo, but as a living inheritance. Unlike dragonborn, whose lineage manifests uniformly, Dragon-Kin display their heritage in varied and personal ways—through antler-like horns, patches of shimmering scales, and tails that move with deliberate balance.

Their draconic ancestry is ancient rather than immediate. In elder ages, a dragon bound its essence to a mortal bloodline, forging a lineage that would never fully return to mortality. Once established, this inheritance does not fade or dilute over generations. A Dragon-Kin family remains draconic indefinitely, which is both the source of their power and the reason for their rarity.

Though uncommon, Dragon-Kin often integrate seamlessly into the cultures they inhabit, identifying more with the societies that raised them than with any unified Dragon-Kin culture. Most Dragon-Kin live between 200 and 300 years, granting them a long memory and a patient outlook shaped by centuries rather than decades.

In Elysia, Dragon-Kin are rare enough to be remembered. Their draconic traits are unmistakable, yet their features remain close enough to mortal folk that their presence feels both familiar and unsettling. Some bloodlines grow fiercely proud—sometimes to the point of arrogance—taking their singular Expression as proof that draconic power does not require draconic form. To many dragonborn, Dragon-Kin are distant cousins: recognizably of draconic stock, yet frustratingly unlike the uniform traditions of dragonborn kind. This tension deepens when a Dragon-Kin’s Expression manifests more dramatically than any dragonborn’s, turning quiet comparison into open rivalry.

Dragon-Kin do not share a unified naming tradition. Most bear names drawn from the cultures that raised them, and many adopt new names over long lives. Some take mortal surnames to mark belonging; others abandon them in favor of titles and epithets earned through reputation, age, or pride.
Your Dragon-Kin character has the following racial traits.

Ability Score Increase. Increase two different ability scores of your choice by 1.
Size. Your size is Medium.
Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.
Darkvision. You have darkvision out to 30 feet. In addition, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
Draconic Will. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
Cultural Adaptation. You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice, or you learn one additional language of your choice.
Draconic Insight. You gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: Perception, Nature, Survival, or Insight.
Draconic Expression. Your draconic heritage manifests in one dominant form. Choose one of the following options: Great Wings, Draconic Magic, or Great Horns. Your Expression shapes your body as much as your power: wings may unfurl, horns may grow more ornate and vividly colored, or your tail may thicken and your irises sharpen into a distinctly draconic clarity as your magic intensifies.
Draconic Color. Choose one draconic color. Your color determines your draconic damage type.

setters.set: Ambrose, Caelin, Kaien, Thalos, Orien, Valen, Eryndor, Drazan, Orryx, Rhavon, Soryn, Veydran, Zephir, Aurel
Elfaria, Lianhua, Astra, Calyra, Draeva, Eiryn, Nyvara, Rhaela, Saphira, Velyss, Lurie, Valoria, Meilin, Xianru
Lang, Ashscale, Brightwing, Cindertalon, Dawncrest, Emberborn, Frostvein, Ironsong, Stormbrand, Voidcoil, Wyrmspire, Viremont, Morwyn, Veloren
the Gilded, the Everbound, the Ascendant, the Long-Watched, the Last Scale, the Undying Flame, the Azure Heir, the Star-Woken, the Crystal-Blooded, of the Crimson Wing

description.p: Increase two different ability scores of your choice by 1.
You have darkvision out to 30 feet. In addition, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

sheet.description: Darkvision 30 ft. Advantage on sight-based Wisdom (Perception) checks.

description.p: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

sheet.description: Advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

description.p: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice, or you learn one additional language of your choice.
You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice.
You learn one additional language of your choice.
You gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: Perception, Nature, Survival, or Insight.
Your draconic heritage manifests in one dominant form. Choose one of the following options: Great Wings, Draconic Magic, or Great Horns.

Your Expression shapes your appearance as much as your power. Wings may unfurl, horns may grow more ornate and vividly colored, or your tail may thicken and your irises sharpen into a distinctly draconic clarity as your magic intensifies.

You possess powerful, draconic wings. You can manifest your wings to gain a flying speed of 30 feet for a total of 10 minutes per day. These minutes can be used all at once or in shorter increments (no action required). You regain expended minutes when you finish a long rest.
As your power grows, your wings become more pronounced—broader, stronger, and unmistakably draconic in silhouette.

sheet.description: Fly speed 30 ft for up to 10 minutes per long rest (track minutes spent).

description.p: Your draconic power erupts outward in a controlled burst rather than a practiced breath weapon.

As an action, you release a pulse of draconic energy in a 15-foot radius centered on yourself. Each creature of your choice in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus.
A creature takes {{dragon-kin:pulse:dice count}}d{{dragon-kin:pulse:dice size}} damage of your draconic damage type on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.
The damage increases by 1d4 at 5th level, 10th level, and 15th level. You can use this trait twice, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

Dragon-Kin who manifest this Expression often show it in subtle, unsettling ways: a thicker, more deliberate tail, a brighter sheen to their scales, and irises that take on a distinctly draconic clarity.

sheet.description: Pulse (DC {{dragon-kin:pulse:dc}} Con): 15-ft radius centered on you. Failed save: {{dragon-kin:pulse:dice count}}d{{dragon-kin:pulse:dice size}} {{draconic-color:damage type}} damage; success: half. (+1d4 at 5th/10th/15th)

description.p: Your horns and scales serve as conduits for draconic resilience.
When you take damage of your draconic damage type, you can use your reaction to gain the benefits of absorb elements. You can use this trait twice per long rest.
In addition, you have resistance to your draconic damage type.
Dragon-Kin with this Expression often develop larger, more ornate horns and more vivid coloration along the brow and crest, as though their lineage is trying to declare itself.

sheet.description: When you take {{draconic-color:damage type}} damage, you can use your reaction to gain the benefits of absorb elements. You have resistance to {{draconic-color:damage type}}.

description.p: Choose your draconic color. Your color determines your draconic damage type.

sheet.description: Draconic Color: {{draconic-color}}. Damage type: {{draconic-color:damage type}}. Temperament: {{draconic-color:temperament}}.
